column4: why does eth0 get a different mac address when i unplug/replug the ethernet cord?
huh? a different ip? MAC adresses are attached to the hardware and shouldn't change
i know. but it does. from  aa:00:04:00:0a:04  to 00:16:d4:e1:bd:56
trying to set up a static ip but i only have one of those forwarded
maybe "dmesg" gives some hints on how and why it is happenning ?
do an unplug plug cycle  and do « dmesg | tail -n30 » paste that in a pastebin
meganerd translating the mac addresses shows Vendor =  Digital Equipment Corporation, but  Compal Communications after unplug/replug
what about /etc/udev/rules.d/70-persistent-net.rules ? what does the file says?
ATTR{address}=="00:16:d4:e1:bd:56" <<< that looks like the ral adress....
right. that's the one ive assigned to the static ip
dunno where the other comes from
maybe is nteworkmanager? what is the eth0 conf in NM ?
meganerd that's the ip that shows up in ifconfig after unplug/replug. but booting with ethernet cord in will give an ifconfig mac of aa:00:04:00:0a:04
